body_html: I'm a bit confused that the original error was "double free or corruption," and when I stepped through the code it got to line 71 to throw before segfaulting (AT_ERROR("'lengths' array has to be sorted in decreasing order");), whereas here it's pointing to line 67 ((*batch_sizes++) = current_batch_size;) and saying "heap-buffer-overflow"
body_text: I'm a bit confused that the original error was "double free or corruption," and when I stepped through the code it got to line 71 to throw before segfaulting (AT_ERROR("'lengths' array has to be sorted in decreasing order");), whereas here it's pointing to line 67 ((*batch_sizes++) = current_batch_size;) and saying "heap-buffer-overflow"
body: I'm a bit confused that the original error was "double free or corruption," and when I stepped through the code it got to line 71 to throw before segfaulting (`AT_ERROR("'lengths' array has to be sorted in decreasing order");`), whereas here it's pointing to line 67 (`(*batch_sizes++) = current_batch_size;`) and saying "heap-buffer-overflow"
